newsitem.title: GERMANY: Daimler optimistic on China plant deal.
newsitem.headline: Daimler optimistic on China plant deal.

text.p: Daimler-Benz AG said Friday that it was confident a disagreement it is having with the Chinese government over a plant to be built there can be resolved and that the project will move ahead.

The Wall Street Journal reported Friday that Daimler is threatening to abandon a $1 billion joint venture to build minivans in China because it wants to build a single plant, while its partner, state-run Nanfang South China Motor Corp., wants to build two plants.
Since the deal was reached in 1995, China also has changed conditions in the agreement, the journal said.
The newspaper quoted Jurgen Hubbert, the Daimler-Benz board member who oversees world-wide passenger-car sales, as saying Mercedes would withdraw from China if the issues could not be resolved.
A Daimler spokesman said Friday, however, that "the project is not dead," adding that the company had a lot of patience.
